frame.name: Change_accessibility
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes a <fen>Useful_location</fen> to become accessible (or non-accessible) to a <fen>Theme</fen> to a certain <fen>Degree</fen>. Instead of the <fen>Useful_location</fen>, the scene may be described with reference to a <fen>Portal</fen> (or part of the <fen>Portal</fen>, e.g., a door) to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
<ex><fex name="age">They</fex>'ve <t>blockaded</t> <fex name="por">the entrance</fex> -- no one can get in or out.</ex>
<ex><fex name="age">Police</fex> have <t>cordoned off</t> <fex name="use">the area where the crime occurred</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="use">The area</fex> has been <t>barricaded</t> <fex name="the">to anyone but law enforcement officials</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> blocks access to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
<ex><fex name="age">Police</fex> have <t>cordoned off</t> the area where the crime took place.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Useful_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Useful_location</fen> is the place the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards and the <fen>Agent</fen> has changed the accessibility of.
<ex>Protestors <t>barricaded</t> <fex name="use">a highway that connects the industrial sectors to the ports</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards, or has an intention or tendency to head towards, the <fen>Useful_location</fen>, but is potentially blocked due to actions of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>Authorities <t>barricaded</t> the road <fex name="the">to all traffic</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Useful_location</fen> is or is not accessible.</def-root>

FE.name: Portal
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> may regulate access to the <fen>Useful_location</fen> by regulating access to a <fen>Portal</fen>, including a part of the portal that could block potential <fen>Theme</fen>s, such as doors or gates. <ex>They've <t>blockaded</t> <fex name="por">the entrance</fex> -- no one can get in or out.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<m>probably, presumably, mysteriously</m>), force (<m>hard, softly</m>), secondary effects (<m>quietly, loudly</m>), and general descriptions comparing events (<m>the same way</m>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<m>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</m>).
<ex>The debate is on regarding the trial of individuals accused of <fex name="man">non-violently</fex> <t>barricading</t> downtown pet stores.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action carried out by the <fen>Agent</fen> to bring about the change in accessibility.
<ex>The students <t>barricaded</t> the doorways <fex name="mea">by lining up in two rows surrounding the building</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the accessibility of the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
<ex>A rebel group <t>blockaded</t> the roadways <fex name="tim">late last night</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The general <fen>Place</fen> where the blocking or allowing of access occurs.
<ex>Many roads were <t>cordorned off</t> <fex name="pla">in the central district</fex> right after the incident.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the accessibility of the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
<ex>They clearly <t>blockaded</t> this route <fex name="pur">to prevent anyone from sneaking past their surveillance technology</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>A portion of the <fen>Useful_location</fen>, usually its edge, where accessibility is blocked.
<ex>Police <t>cordoned</t> <t>off</t> the park <fex name="sub">along its southern edge</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Instrument</fen> to block access, often by placing the <fen>Instrument</fen> such that it cannot be traversed.
<ex>They <t>barricaded</t> the doors <fex name="ins">with heavy crates and rusted machinery</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: barricade.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: block off an area, especially by erecting barriers.

lexUnit.name: blockade.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: prevent access to an area.

lexUnit.name: cordon off.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: block off an area, typically by surrounding it.

lexUnit.name: road-block.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a barrier to passage on a roadway, especially as erected by government or law enforcement.

lexUnit.name: block off.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: place barriers to entering or exiting an area or building.

lexUnit.name: blockade.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an act of preventing access to an area.
